meanings.definition: The quality or state of being penetrable.
meanings.sent1: The penetrability of the fabric allowed the needle to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The penetrability of the soil determined how quickly water could seep through.
meanings.sent3: The magician's cloak had such high penetrability that he could make objects disappear effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a penetrability that touched the hearts of everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The penetrability of the fog made it impossible to see more than a few feet ahead.

meanings.definition: The ability to be penetrated or pierced.
meanings.sent1: The armor's penetrability was tested by striking it with a sharp blade.
meanings.sent2: The penetrability of the balloon allowed it to be easily popped with a pin.
meanings.sent3: The cake's penetrability by the fork made it easy to take a bite.
meanings.sent4: His words had a penetrability that cut through her defenses.
meanings.sent5: The penetrability of the ice was evident as the skates glided effortlessly over its surface.
